var_name_description: The observation number.
The ID associated with the study.
The name of the study.
The effect of an additional year of schooling on logarithmic wage.
The standard error of the main effect.
The t-statistic of the main effect.
=1 if the estimates within the study can be aggregated on a city level.
=1 if the estimates within the study can be aggregated on a regional level.
=1 if the estimates within the study can be aggregated on a country level.
The number of observations associated with the estimate.
The number of regressands in the regression.
The number of degrees of freedom in the regression.
The logarithm of the number of estimates collected from the study.
The average number of years of schooling attained by the subjects.
The average number of years of experience attained by the subjects.
=1 if authors report schooling in years.
=1 if the authors report schooling in levels (e.g., attained college degree) (reference category).
=1 if the dependent variable in the regression is log hourly wage.
=1 if the dependent variable in the regression is log daily or weekly wage (reference category).
=1 if the dependent variable in the regression is log monthly or annual wage.
=1 if the study uses data from a survey.
=1 if the study uses data from a national register (reference category).
=1 if the study uses cross-sectional data.
=1 if the study uses panel data (reference category).
The logarithm of the average year of the study's time span
The ratio of wage earners to self-employed subjects in the study ( = 1 if wage earner, = 0 if self-employed).
The ratio of self-employed to wage earners subjects in the study ( = 1 if self-employed, = 0 if wage earner) (reference category).
The ratio of male to female subjects in the study ( = 1 if male, = 0 if female).
The ratio of female to male subjects in the study ( = 1 if female, = 0 if male) (reference category).
The ratio of white workers ( = 1 if white, = 0 if non-white).
The ratio of non-white workers ( = 1 if non-white, = 0 if white). (reference category).
The ratio of Caucasian to non-Caucasian subjects in the study ( = 1 if Caucasian, = 0 if not).
The ratio of non-Caucasian to Caucasian subjects in the study ( = 1 if non-Caucasian, = 0 if Caucasian) (reference category).
The ratio of non-married subjects to subjects who are married ( = 1 if married, = 0 if non-married).
The ratio of married subjects to subjects who are not married ( = 1 if non-married, = 0 if married). (reference category).
The percentage of subjects that are identical twins.
The percentage of subjects that are fraternal twins.
The percentage of subjects that are not twins (reference category).
The country in which the study was conducted.
=1 if the study was conducted in a high income country (reference category)
=1 if the study was conducted in a middle income country
The logarithm of the median expenditure in the country in a given year.
The logarithm of the minimum wage in the country in a given year.
The academic freedom index reported for the country in a given year.
The logarithm of the average age of the subjects.
=1 if the authors use Ordinary least squares  (reference category).
=1 if the authors use Generalized Least Squares.
=1 if the authors use  Selection-effects or Fixed-effects estimation.
=1 if the authors use First Differences.
=1 if the authors use First-Differenced IV estimation.
=1 if the authors use Instrumental variables estimation.
=1 if the authors use sibling's education as an instrument in the regression.
=1 if the authors smoking as an instrument in the regression.
=1 if the authors use another instrument in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for age in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for age in quadratic form in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for experience in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for ethnicity in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for gender in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for marriage in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for firm characteristics in the regression.
=1 if the authors control for area type in the regression (e.g., urban, rural).
=1 if the authors control for macroeconomic variables in the regression.
The logarithm of the Journal Citations Report impact factor of the study (as of January 2023; = 0 in case of no publication).
The logarithm of the mean number of Google Scholar citations received per year since the appearance of the study in Google Scholar (as of January 2023).
=1 if the study was published in a journal.
=1 if the study was not published in a journal (reference category).
The logarithm of the number of years between the publication (or issuing) of this study and the publication year of the earliest published study in the sample.
